Package fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.haavistoartur

Class Main

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.haavistoartur.Main
public class Main
extends java.lang.Object
The lotto program. The program calculates that how many years it would take to get a jackpot from the lottery.
Author:
Artur Haavisto

  • Constructor Details

    • Main

      public Main()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method which runs the program. A user can give lotto numbers as command line arguments or when asked. A user is asked if they want to see weekly results. The program runs until the jackpot is won within 120 years. The results are shown every time the jackpot has been won.
      Parameters:
      args - Lotto numbers.

    • askLottoNumbers

      public static int[] askLottoNumbers()
      The method asks the user for lotto numbers and returns them as an array. An error message is shown if given number already exists in the newlottoUser. If the given number passes the qualifications, it is put to the newlottoUser. When all of the numbers have been asked, it returns the created array.
      Returns:
      The created lotto array.

    • calculateLotto

      public static int[] calculateLotto()
      The method creates a random lotto row and returns it as an array.
      Returns:
      The created lotto row.

    • createRightNumbers

      public static int[][] createRightNumbers()
      The method creates a 2D array which has amountOfLottoNumbers rows and one column. The rows are numbered from 1 to amountOfLottoNumbers. It returns the created array.
      Returns:
      The array which has amountOfLottoNumbers amount of rows numbered 1 to amountOfLottoNumbers and the column size of 1.

    • printResults

      public static void printResults()
      The method prints the results which shows how many years it took to get 1 to amountOfLottoNumbers right lotto numbers.

    • printWeeklyResults

      public static void printWeeklyResults​(int amount, int time)
      The method prints the weekly results.
      Parameters:
      amount - An amount of numbers right on the lotto row.
      time - A time in years.

    • createOneResult

      public static java.lang.String createOneResult​(int amount, int time)
      The method creates and returns a string which tells how many lotto numbers was right and how many years is passed.
      Parameters:
      amount - An amount of lotto numbers right.
      time - A number of years passed.
      Returns:
      A string that tells how many lotto numbers was right and how many years passed.

    • arrayToString

      public static java.lang.String arrayToString​(java.lang.String[] array)
      The method converts an array to specific format of a string and then returns it. The specific format looks for example like "[value1, value2, value3]".
      Parameters:
      array - An array.
      Returns:
      A string that was converted from an array to specific format.
